Group
Functions
new

Parameters: _side, _groupType,

_side

Side (west, east, etc) of this group

_groupType

Number, group type, see GROUP_TYPE

Returns: nil

delete
getMessageLoop

See MessageReceiver.getMessageLoop

Returns: MessageLoop

addUnit

Adds existing Unit to this group. Also use it when you want to move unit between groups.

Parameters: _units

_unit

Unit to add

Returns: nil

addGroup

Moves all units from second group into this group.

Parameters: _group

_group

the group to move into this group

_delete

Boolean, true - deletes the abandoned group. Default: false.

Returns: nil

removeUnit

Removes a unit from this group.

Access: internal use

Parameters: _unit, _newGroup

_unit

Unit that will be removed from this group.

Returns: nil

getUnits

Returns an array with units in this group.

Returns: Array of units.

getInfantryUnits

Returns all infantry units.

Returns: Array of units.

getVehicleUnits

Returns all vehicle units.

Returns: Array of units.

getDroneUnits

Returns all drone units.

Returns: Array of units.

getType

Returns GROUP_TYPE

Returns: Number, group type. See GROUP_TYPE,

getSide

Returns side of this group

Returns: Side

getGroupHandle

Returns the group handle of this group.

Returns: group handle.

getLeader

Returns the leader of the group.  !!! Warning: might return a dead unit!

Returns: Unit object

setLeader

Sets the leader of this group to a specified Unit. The Unit must belong to this group.

setGarrison

Sets the Garrison of this garrison.  Use Garrison.addGroup to add a group to a garrison.

Access: internal use.

Parameters: _garrison

_garrison

Garrison

Returns: nil

getGarrison

Returns the Garrison this Group is attached to.

Returns: String, Garrison

getAI

Returns the AI of this group, if it's spawned, or "" otherwise.

Returns: String, <AIGroup>

isSpawned

Returns the spawned state of this group

Returns: Bool

isEmpty

Returns true if group has no units in it

Returns: Bool

handleUnitRemoved

Called when the unit has been removed (killed or moved to a different place).

Must be called inside the group's thread, not inside event handler.

Returns: nil

handleUnitDespawned

NYI

Returns: nil

handleUnitSpawned

NYI

Returns: nil

createAI

Creates an <AIGroup> for this group.

Access: internal.

Returns: nil

spawnAtLocation

Spawns all the units in this group at specified location.

Parameters: _loc

_loc

Location where the group will spawn.

Returns: nil

spawnVehiclesOnRoad

Spawns vehicles in this group specified positions, one after another. Infantry units are spawned nearby.  This function is intended for vehicle groups to spawn them on a road.

Parameters: _vehPosAndDir, _startPos

_vehPosAndDir

array of [_posATL, _dir] where vehicles will be spawned.

_startPos

positoon ATL, optional, if used, then _vehPosAndDir will be ignored and the function will find positions on road on its own.

Returns: nil

spawnAtPos

Vehicles are spawned at road nearest to the provided position, infantry units are spawned at provided position.

Parameters: _pos

_pos

position

Returns: nil

despawn

Despawns all units in this group. Also deletes the group handle.

Returns: nil

sort

Makes passed units rejoin this group in specified order. Useful for reorganizing formation for convoys.  !!!WARNING!!! If you pass an array with all units in the group, then group handle will be changed!

Parameters: _unitsSorted

_unitsSorted

Array with Unit objects

Returns: nil

getSubagents

Returns subagents of this agent.  For group subagents are its units, since their <AIUnit> is processed synchronosuly with <AIGroup> by default.

Access: Used by AI class

Returns: array of units.

getPossibleGoals

Returns the list of goals this agent evaluates on its own.

Access: Used by AI class

Returns: Array with goal class names

getPossibleActions

Returns the list of actions this agent can use for planning.

Access: Used by AI class

Returns: Array with action class names

serialize

See MessageReceiver.serialize

deserialize

See MessageReceiver.deserialize

transferOwnership

See MessageReceiver.transferOwnership

createUnitsFromTemplate

Creates units from template and adds them to this group.

Parameters: _template, _subcatID

_template

<Template>

_subcatID

subcategory of this group template

Returns: Number, amount of created units.

getRequiredCrew

Returns amount of needed drivers and turret operators for all vehicles in this group. Also returns amount of available cargo seats.

Returns: [_nDrivers, _nTurrets, _nCargo]
